title: United
content: As someone who supports the civilian use and entertainment value of expensive military hardware ( [H1](http://web.archive.org/web/20060526005627/http:/membres.lycos.fr/voituresrares/mondial/photos/hautdegamme.htm)’s, [Ferret Armored Cars](http://web.archive.org/web/20060526005627/http:/www.deltaforce.net/ferret/ferret8.html) and the [Blue Angels](http://web.archive.org/web/20060526005627/http:/www.military.cz/usa/air/in_service/aircraft/angels/angels_en.htm)) I’m excited about House Industries release [United](http://web.archive.org/web/20060526005627/http:/www.houseind.com/) (I’ve been reposting House’ teasers for the past few months). But I wonder how this will play out amongst your average designer and international audiences?
author: sii

comments.content:
_your average designer_

those guys are wussies and shold tuffen up. What if we are invaded by giant alien reptiles from space and soemoen has to to kick they’re but??!!

\>those guys are wussies and shold tuffen up.

I think you’re on to something. Boot camp for designers! Better still a tour of duty (or two) in Basingstoke.

\>What if we are invaded by giant alien reptiles from space and soemoen has to to kick they’re but??!!

Well, the design community may be able to come together with a series of posters promoting alien awareness or perhaps a signage system directing the aliens to “our leaders”. Better still a coffee table book with some tastefully moody black and white alien pictures and series of essays from film makers and product designers. Well there goes next years April Fools…
I don’t think gridnik has anything to worry about.
Being a Brit Si I thought you would be into those Red Arrows…

Overkill? Ain’t no such thang! This _ **is** _ the time for superfamilies after all. :^D

\>Being a Brit Si I thought you would be into those Red Arrows…

True, one of me best memories was visiting the Red Arrows base as a child while in the Cub Scouts. However my daughter was born on Seattle’s Seafair Sunday with the Angels overhead so I have a soft spot for them too.

\> wow. 105 fonts! that’s bordering on overkill!

Shock and awe!
